title: Private company replaced council landscaping services on Lansdowne Estate

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
A new private company called Project Lansdowne has recently started working on the Lansdowne Estate in Sheffield.
Please could you provide information on:
1) the checks completed on this Project Lansdowne before they were appointed to ensure that they had adequate training and experience to replace the council landscaping staff members
2) what checks are made on Project Lansdowne to ensure they are hiring and managing their staff responsibly
3) the procurement process undertaken to appoint this Project Lansdowne.
Yours faithfully,
Amy J.

Dear Amy J,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Project Lansdowne
which we received on 27/08/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Project Lansdowne is a Limited company that has been established by local
residents, they are not SCC employees, nor have they been contracted to
carry out work by SCC. They have not been given permission by the Exec
Director to carry out any work on SCC assets, we have written to them
asking that they seek permission when requesting to carry out work on SCC
assets as we would for any volunteer/community group, we have not procured
them to carry out any work, we have not paid them to carry out any work.
[extraneous material removed]
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
